intro: Acrotaphros bibracteata, commonly known as the two-bract acrotaphros, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two bracts at the base of the inflorescence, which are modified leaves that serve a protective function. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common floral arrangement in the Apiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
